# Create wide format dataframe for Age
This time I removed cities with voters under 5 in each age category on average, this means I removed the cities with total voters under 5 voters * 22 age categories = 110 voters.
```{r}
# Duplicate each row and create new df accounting for the number of eligible voters in each row
ZZ22_long <- ZZ22[rep(seq_len(nrow(ZZ22)), ZZ22$NUMBER_OF_VOTERS_PROFILE),]

ZZ22_wider_age <- ZZ22_long|>　
  filter(!AGE_GROUP_CODE == -3) |>
  group_by(CITY_NAME, AGE_GROUP_CODE) |>
  summarise(N = n(), .groups = 'drop') |>
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = AGE_GROUP_CODE,
    values_from = N
  ) 

# transform from NA to 0
ZZ22_wider_age[is.na(ZZ22_wider_age)] <- 0

# add the variable shows total voters across ages
ZZ22_wider_age <- ZZ22_wider_age |>
  mutate(Total = rowSums(ZZ22_wider_age[, 2:23]))

# change the order of age variables
ZZ22_wider_age <- ZZ22_wider_age |>
  select("CITY_NAME", "1600", "1700", "1800", "1900", "2000", "2124", "2529", "3034", "3539", "4044",
         "4549", "5054", "5559", "6064", "6569", "7074", "7579", "8084", "8589", "9094", "9599", 
         "9999", "Total")

# remove cities with total voters under 110.
ZZ22_wider_age_rm <- ZZ22_wider_age |>
  filter(!Total < 110)

# check the total number of each column(age category)
colSums(ZZ22_wider_age_rm[, 2:24])

```
Factor Analysis (city vs year)
```{r}
# Standardize the data in columns except the first one(city name column)
ZZ22_wider_age_rm[, -1] <- scale(ZZ22_wider_age_rm[, -1])

# Used Ward's method
hage <- hclust(dist(ZZ22_wider_age_rm[, -c(1, 24)], method = "euclidean"),"ward.D2")

plot(hage, main = 'Year', hang = -1, cex = .6)
# there seems to be three clusters from this Hierarchical clustering dendrogram、

# print out the number of observations in each cluster
table(cutree(hage, k=3))

# Assignment of clusters to each city
clusters_age <- cutree(hage, k=3)
ZZ22_wider_age_rm$cluster <- clusters_age

# visualize the dendrogram
hage2 <- hcut(ZZ22_wider_age_rm[, -c(1, 24)], k=3, hc_method = "ward.D2", stand = F)
# cluster size
hage2$size
# visualize the dendrogram
fviz_dend(hage2,rect=T)
# visualize the cluster
fviz_cluster(hage2)
```
